newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia drops TV ad that puts hair above army.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia drops TV ad that puts hair above army.

text.p: Two Indonesian television stations have dropped an advertisement for a hair cream after the armed forces complained that it appeared to belittle military service, the Republika newspaper reported on Wednesday.
"From (Tuesday) we have stopped broadcasting the adverstisement until it is revised," Andreas Ambesa, a spokesman for private Indosiar station, was quoted as saying.
A spokesman for the Rajawali Citra Televisi Indonesia station, a unit of Bimantara Citra, confirmed the channel had dropped the ad after receving a letter from the armed forces.

The ad shows a young man with a wavy lock across his forehead speaking on the telephone to his girlfriend who says it is a pity he will be entering Akabri, the academy for military officers, because he will have to cut his hair.
Senior military officers said they were concerned the ad could give the impression that a man's hairstyle was more important than his career as a military officer, Republika said.
"We have not asked for the advertisement to be pulled, only revised a little," Lieutenant-Colonel Surachman, academy spokesman, was quoted as saying.
